summary: Define role/access rules: interventions are visible to all users but only editable by their creator; manage a shared client blacklist; remove administrator access.
architectural_notes: Access control rule: intervention records are readable by all users, but update/delete is restricted to the record creator (owner-based permissions).
Blacklist is a shared/global list editable by all users (no admin-only control).
Remove/disable administrator role and any admin-only permission checks.

existing_features.title: Remove the administrator unlock flow from the frontend for blacklist management, and make the blacklist panel fully usable by any authenticated user without entering an admin code.
Update frontend user-facing text related to blacklist/admin access to English and remove admin-specific wording (e.g., "Admin access required", "Unlock", "admin code required").

Ensure interventions remain viewable to all authenticated users, but only the user who created an intervention can edit or delete it; keep both backend enforcement and frontend UI affordances aligned with this rule.

new_feature_requests.summary: Interventions: accessible/visible to all users, but only the user who created an intervention can modify it
Client blacklist: allow all users to add/remove clients from a shared blacklist

Update backend authorization so that any authenticated user can add/remove a client from the shared blacklist (markAsBlacklisted / unmarkAsBlacklisted), and remove any admin-only restriction for these actions.

projectName: Make interventions viewable by all users, restrict editing to author, and remove admin-only blacklist access
